doc.description:
A permission system linked to options, User classes and preferences.
 *
A permission is an optioon under the permission option ("permissions", "appui") or one oof its aliases.
They are ONLY permissions.
 *
No!!! From the moment a user or a group has a preference on an item, it is considered to have a permission.
No!!! Deleting a permission deletes the preference

tags.todo: Store the deleted preferences? And restore them if the a permission is re-given

name: bbn\User\Permissions

__construct.name: __construct

fromPath.name: fromPath
fromPath.summary: Returns the option's ID corresponds to the given path.

toPath.name: toPath

options.name: options
options.summary: Returns the result of Appui\Option::options filtered with only the ones authorized to the current user.

fullOptions.name: fullOptions
fullOptions.summary: Returns the result of Appui\Option::full_options filtered with only the ones authorized to the current user.

getAll.name: getAll
getAll.summary: Returns the full list of permissions existing in the given option

getFull.name: getFull
getFull.summary: Returns the full list of permissions existing in the given option with all the current user's preferences

get.name: get
get.summary: Returns an option combined with its sole/first permission

has.name: has
has.summary: Checks if a user and/or a group has a permission.

hasDeep.name: hasDeep
hasDeep.summary: Checks if a user and/or a group has a permission for the given option or for its childern.

is.name: is
is.summary: Checks if an option corresponds to the given path.

customize.name: customize
customize.summary: Adapts a given array of options' to user's permissions

add.name: add
add.summary: Grants a new permission to a user or a group

remove.name: remove
remove.summary: Deletes a preference for a path or an ID.

optionToPermission.name: optionToPermission

readOption.name: readOption
readOption.summary: Checks if the category represented by the given option ID is readable by the current user

writeOption.name: writeOption
writeOption.summary: Checks if the category represented by the given option ID is writable by the current user

getSources.name: getSources

accessExists.name: accessExists

updateAll.name: updateAll

create.name: create

test.name: test
test.summary: Checks whether the error property has been set (so an error happened).

parent.name: test
parent.summary: Checks whether the error property has been set (so an error happened).

check.name: check
check.summary: Checks whether the error property has been set (so an error happened).

parent.name: check
parent.summary: Checks whether the error property has been set (so an error happened).

log.name: log

parent.name: log

__call.name: __call

parent.name: __call

getInstance.name: getInstance
getInstance.summary: Returns the instance of the singleton or null.

retrieverExists.name: retrieverExists
retrieverExists.summary: Returns true if an instance as been initiated.

getOptionsObject.name: getOptionsObject

getOptionId.name: getOptionId
getOptionId.summary: Returns The option's ID of a category, i.e. direct children of option's root

getOptionsIds.name: getOptionsIds

getAppuiOptionId.name: getAppuiOptionId
getAppuiOptionId.summary: Returns The option's ID of a category, i.e. direct children of option's root

getAppuiOptionsIds.name: getAppuiOptionsIds
